abstract.text: A name identifier for a joint.

inlineContent.text: Use this class to access information about a named joint, such as its index in a skeleton’s array of joints, or its position on the screen or in the physical environment.
When you’re tracking a body in 2D space, you get the screen-space position of a named joint by using the
When you’re tracking a body in 3D space, you get a named joint’s position in either local or model space by using the

abstract.text: Integrate hardware sensing features to produce augmented reality apps and games.
The interface for the skeleton of a tracked body.
A name identifier for a joint.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the head.
Returns a joint name that corresponds to a key point defined in a human body pose.
Creates a new joint name.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the left foot.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the left hand.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the left shoulder.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the right foot.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the right hand.
A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the right shoulder.
A skeletal joint that’s the root of all other joints.
The particular configuration of joints that define a body’s current state.
Tells you whether ARKit tracks a joint at a particular index.
The skeleton’s total number of joints.
Returns the location of a joint with a given name.
Returns the local transform for a joint with a given name.
Returns the model transform for a joint with a given name.
The data type for all recognized point keys.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
